thread.title: High school football: Five things to watch
thread.title_full: High school football: Five things to watch - Times Union

author: James Allen
title: High school football: Five things to watch
text:
Photo: Cindy Schultz Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Columbia's Conner Kinzelmann, center, carries the ball during their football game against Shenendehowa on Friday, Sept. 6, 2013, at Shenendehowa High in Clifton Park, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Columbia's Conner Kinzelmann, center, carries the ball during their football game against Shenendehowa on Friday, Sept. 6, 2013, at Shenendehowa High in Clifton Park, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Photo: Cindy Schultz High school football: Five things to watch 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 1 A trio of winner-takes-all title games highlight the Week 7 schedule: Schalmont (6-0, 4-0) at Ravena (6-0, 4-0) for the Class B Reinfurt Division, Fonda (5-0, 3-0) at Coxsackie-Athens (4-2, 3-0) for the Class C South Division and Whitehall (6-0, 4-0) at Cambridge (6-0, 4-0) for the Class D overall title.
2 There are two Class B games that will determine the No. 4 seed in each division: Broadalbin-Perth (1-5, 1-3) at Johnstown (2-4, 1-3) Friday and Hudson (2-4, 2-3) at Albany Academy (3-3, 2-3) Saturday.
3 Columbia (4-2, 3-1), a program that finished 2-7 in 2014 and 3-6 in 2013, can secure the No. 2 seed from the Class AA Liberty Division on Friday with a win at Bethlehem (3-3, 2-2). A win by the Eagles could set up a three-way tie for second behind Shaker (6-0, 4-0).
More Information
Contact James Allen at 518-454- 5062 or email jallen@timesunion.com
4 Streaks for the longest consecutive years in the playoffs extended in 2015 are Cambridge (21), Burnt Hills (20) and Fonda (20).
5 Albany High's new turf field debuts Saturday at 5:30 p.m. when the Falcons (0-6, 0-4) play host to CBA (1-5, 0-4). Admission is free.
